etymology.description: Triplication of 虫(虫) (chóng, "snake; insect") -> representation of multiple insects or a group of insects -> evolves to mean 'insect'
etymology.interpretation: The character 蟲(chóng, "insect") visually emphasizes the idea of a group of insects or a swarm by repeating the depiction of 虫(虫) (chóng, "snake; insect"), symbolizing an abundance or multiplicity of insect-like creatures.
etymology.simplification: 虫 is a simplified form where tripod 虫 components in 蟲 were reduced to a single 虫 for simplicity.

examples.chinese: 花園裡有很多蟲(花園裡有很多蟲)。
examples.pinyin: Huāyuán lǐ yǒu hěn duō chóng.
examples.english: There are many insects in the garden.

examples.chinese: 我看到一隻蟲(我看到一隻蟲)，爬上了牆(爬上了牆)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ kàn dào yī zhī chóng, pá shàng le qiáng.
examples.english: I saw an insect, and it crawled up the wall.

examples.chinese: 蟲在夜晚飛舞(蟲在夜晚飛舞)。
examples.english: Insects dance in the night air.
